  <div class="csl-entry" style="clear: left; margin-bottom: 1em;">
    <div class="csl-left-margin" style="float: left; padding-right: 0.5em;text-align: right; width: 1em;">1.</div><div class="csl-right-inline" style="margin: 0 .4em 0 1.5em;">Waddington, C.H. (1953). Genetic assimilation of an acquired character. Evolution <i>7</i>, 118–126. <a href="https://doi.org/10.2307/2405747">10.2307/2405747</a>.</div>
  </div>
  <span class="Z3988" title="url_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fzotero.org%3A2&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.2307%2F2405747&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F2405747&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.atitle=Genetic%20assimilation%20of%20an%20acquired%20character&amp;rft.jtitle=Evolution&amp;rft.volume=7&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.aufirst=C%20H&amp;rft.aulast=Waddington&amp;rft.au=C%20H%20Waddington&amp;rft.date=1953&amp;rft.pages=118%E2%80%93126&amp;rft.spage=118&amp;rft.epage=126&amp;rft.issn=00143820"></span>
  <div class="csl-entry" style="clear: left; margin-bottom: 1em;">
    <div class="csl-left-margin" style="float: left; padding-right: 0.5em;text-align: right; width: 1em;">2.</div><div class="csl-right-inline" style="margin: 0 .4em 0 1.5em;">Mery, F., and Kawecki, T.J. (2004). The Effect of Learning on Experimental Evolution of Resource Preference in Drosophila Melanogaster. Evolution <i>58</i>, 757. <a href="https://doi.org/10.1554/03-540">10.1554/03-540</a>.</div>
  </div>

    <div class="csl-left-margin" style="float: left; padding-right: 0.5em;text-align: right; width: 1em;">3.</div><div class="csl-right-inline" style="margin: 0 .4em 0 1.5em;">Suzuki, Yuichiro., and Nijhout, H.F. (2006). Evolution of a Polyphenism by Genetic Accommodation. Science <i>311</i>, 650–652. <a href="https://doi.org/10.1126/science.1118888">10.1126/science.1118888</a>.</div>

    <div class="csl-left-margin" style="float: left; padding-right: 0.5em;text-align: right; width: 1em;">4.</div><div class="csl-right-inline" style="margin: 0 .4em 0 1.5em;">Zheng, J., Payne, J.L., and Wagner, A. (2019). Cryptic genetic variation accelerates evolution by opening access to diverse adaptive peaks.
